WASHINGTON, D.C.
March 8, 1967
Mr. Jack M. Burke
Radio Station KSAC
Chairman Board of Directors
National Educational Radio
Kansas State University
Manhattan, Kansas 66502
Dear Mr. Burke:
This will acknowledge your letter of
February 22, 1967, regarding the conversation
which you previously had with my assistant,
Charles McBride, Charlie has passed on to me
some of the central points of this discussion, and
I found them most interesting.
I look forward to receiving your research
report on educational radio and to working with
you and your representatives when this matter
is considered by the Senate Committee on
Commerce,
With best wishes, I am
Sincerely,
7
